alert.note: Alert for Rush (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 4:06PM EST until February 23 at 5:05AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Indiana and south central Indiana, including the following counties,Bartholomew, Hancock, Hendricks, Johnson, Marion, Morgan, Rush, Shelby, Brown and Monroe. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 402 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations affected include Nashville near North Fork Salt Creek, and areas along the Flatrock River near Raleigh and Rushville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
